bill_title: to require each legislative candidate to disclose each partnership, limited partnership, and corporation that the candidate represents.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require each legislative candidate to disclose each partnership, limited partnership, and corporation that the candidate represents. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Terms as used in this Act mean: (1) "Business relationship," any partnership, limited partnership, or corporation represented by a legislative candidate in the performance of the candidate's occupation during the calendar year preceding filing the statement required under this Act; (2) "Statement of a business relationship," a description of the type of activity and the nature of the association with the business represented by the legislative candidate. Section 2. Each legislative candidate shall file a statement of a business relationship with the secretary of state within fifteen days after filing a nominating petition. A violation of this Act is a petty offense. An intentional violation of this Act is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 3. The secretary of state shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 prescribing the form for reporting the statement of a business relationship. The value of a business relationship does not need to be reported. Each legislative candidate filing a statement of a business relationship shall subscribe to an oath or affirmation verifying the contents of the statement. Each statement reporting the business relationship of a legislative candidate shall be open to public inspection.
